nodes.bodyText: why change to a keyset if you are going to do a map.get(key) later anyways?

The new Map type doesn't have an entrySet() method, and this was the least ugly way to do it. mapIterator for example has different semantics. I'm not too sure on the details anymore, but I remember spending some time pulling my hair out on this change.
As an alternative, the MultiValuedMap can return a MapIterator, which returns the key when calling "next", and has a dedicated "getValue" method to fetch the value associated to the current entry.
